text.44_Daf, 24_Line: That which it is written (Hosea 14:10) "for straight are the ways of Hashem and the righteous walk upon them and the sinners stumble upon them.
text.44_Daf, 33_Line: We were talking about one path, here are two paths.
text.44_Daf, 35_Line: They that intended for the sake of a commandment, "and the righteous walk upon them," he that intended for the sake of sin, "and sinners stumble upon them."
text.44_Daf, 25_Line: A parable to two people that roast their paschal lambs, one eats it for the purpose of the commandment and one eats it for the purpose of gluttony.
text.44_Daf, 26_Line: The one that eat it for the purpose of the commandment, "and the righteous walk upon them," the one that eats it for the purpose of gluttony, "and the sinners stumble upon them."
text.44_Daf, 36_Line: And maybe he too intended for sake of a commandment?
text.44_Daf, 30_Line: Rather, it is parable to two people, this one has his wife and his sister with him and this one has his wife and his sister with him.
text.44_Daf, 34_Line: Rather, it is a parable to Lot and his daughters that were with him.
text.44_Daf, 23_Line: ...Rabbah the son of Bar Chana said that Rabbi Yochanan said:
text.44_Daf, 31_Line: To this one his wife is set for him and to this one his sister is set for him, the one whose wife is set for him, "the righteous walk upon them," and the one whose sister is set for him, "and the sinners stumble upon them."
text.44_Daf, 29_Line: Although he has not performed the best form of the mitzvah, he still performed the paschal lamb.
text.44_Daf, 28_Line: Is this one called an evildoer?
